content: It .. shouldn't? I don't know how to interpret your screenshot... feel free to file an issue on rust-lang/thanks, though.
Sorry, zulip is glitching and didn't send my text
This isn't really a bug, I just thought it was funny thanks shows Nick Cameron with 5x as many commits as bors in 1.54

oh, well, that's expected -- it'll happen in any non-bors managed project getting merged in. To my knowledge, though, we should treat subtrees and submodules completely identically unless something went wrong in the input (we deduplicate by commit hash, and IIRC the imported commits during subtree merge have the same commit hash in the "parent" repostiory and the one being imported)
Hmm maybe thanks is ignoring submodule commits then? 973 commits in 3 weeks definitely does not sound reasonable
:shrug: ultimately it's not a high priority at all to investigate for me, though likely would be interesting. Maybe the import got messed up, maybe something else went wrong, I don't know
If it got fixed, would the old blog posts get updated? Or are they part of the release and frozen in time?
thanks is entirely independent from the release schedule and we regenerate the whole site each time
